intro: Manilkara thouvenotii, commonly known as the Malabar chestnut, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The tree produces a hard, woody fruit that contains a single seed, which is used in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antidiabetic effects. Manilkara thouvenotii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
